events.title: Fundraiser for 'Australian hero' who disarmed terrorist during Bondi Beach mass shooting surpasses $2.6M
events.description: Australian hero who tackled Bondi Beach gunman receives $2.6M in donations in response to brave actions during deadly attack that left him wounded but praised globally.

events.title: A key piece of Port Arthur-era gun reform remains unfinished. Could it have helped prevent the Bondi attack?
events.description: National register would have allowed police to better assess risk posed by alleged Bondi shooters before attack, expert says Victims of Bondi beach shooting Ten minutes of terror: how the Bondi mass shooting unfolded in real time – video Follow the latest live updates A national firearms register, which would track weapons across the country in real time, was a priority for law enforcement and gun control advocates after the 1996 Port Athur massacre. But almost 30 years later, it remains unfinished. Continue reading...

events.title: Australia launches security review after Bondi Beach terror attack
events.description: Australia is observing a national Day of Reflection one week after the deadly shooting at a Jewish festival on Bondi Beach, with crowds gathering at a waterfront memorial and people across the country lighting candles and holding a minute of silence at exactly 6:47 p.m. local time, the moment the first shots were fired; the attack left 15 people dead and dozens injured, including 13 who remain hospitalized, and was carried out by a father and son, the latter previously flagged for possible radicalization, prompting the prime minister on Sunday to order a review of Australia’s security and intelligence services, as France24 correspondent Richelle Harrison reports with the latest.

events.title: Rabbi Yehoram Ulman tells vigil ‘Sydney can become a beacon of goodness’ – As it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed NSW will move to ban phrase ‘globalise the intifada’ in crackdown on ‘hateful’ rhetoric. Here’s what we know so far Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australian football star pays tribute to Bondi victims in Scottish league game A rising Australian player in Scotland has paid tribute to victims of the Bondi tragedy on an afternoon when Socceroo Martin Boyle shone again. Unfortunately, Zac knew a number of people involved in the tragedy in Bondi Beach. His family stay quite close to there. At 6:47pm, you can light a candle in your window to remember the victims of the antisemitic terrorist attack in Bondi and support those who are grieving. Standing together to show that hatred and violence will never define who we are. Continue reading...

events.title: At least four people killed in mass stabbing in Taipei
events.description: Man, 27, from northern Taiwan reported to have fallen to his death in police chase after rampage through capital At least four people have died in a rare mass stabbing incident in central Taipei after an attacker used smoke grenades to cause chaos as he went on a violent rampage through Taiwan’s capital. Several people were also injured. The suspected assailant is among the dead after he fell from a building during a police chase through a busy shopping district on Friday evening. Continue reading...

events.title: Australia pays tribute to Bondi Beach shooting victims
events.description: Australia is observing a national Day of Reflection one week after the deadly shooting at a Jewish festival on Bondi Beach, with crowds gathering at a waterfront memorial and people across the country lighting candles and holding a minute of silence at exactly 6:47 p.m. local time, the moment the first shots were fired; the attack left 15 people dead and dozens injured, including 13 who remain hospitalized, and was carried out by a father and son, the latter previously flagged for possible radicalization, prompting the prime minister on Sunday to order a review of Australia’s security and intelligence services, as Peter O’Brien reports with the latest.

events.title: ‘We are unbreakable’: defiance marks Bondi attack commemoration after PM is booed
events.description: Jewish leaders call for federal royal commission into Bondi beach attack that killed 15 people as huge crowd marks one week anniversary Victims of Bondi beach shooting Ten minutes of terror: how the Bondi mass shooting unfolded in real time – video Follow the latest live updates Jewish leaders have called for a federal royal commission into the Bondi terror attack, as some members of the crowd booed Anthony Albanese on arrival at the commemoration marking one week since 15 people were killed on the first day of Hanukah. The president of the NSW Board of Jewish Deputies, David Ossip, said it “cannot be disputed” that a federal royal commission was needed, to loud cheers and applause from the crowd of up to 15,000 people gathered at Bondi, where a minute’s silence was held at 6.47pm, the time the attack began. Continue reading...

events.title: Australian state weighs ban on 'globalize the intifada' chants, masked protesters in wake of Hanukkah attack
events.description: Australia's New South Wales is proposing a ban on "globalize the intifada" chants after 15 people were killed in the ISIS-inspired Bondi Beach Hanukkah shooting.

events.title: Former Australian minister says ‘radical Islam pulled the trigger’ in nation's worst terror attack
events.description: Josh Frydenberg slams Anthony Albanese's government over rising antisemitic violence in Australia, warning years of inaction enabled extremism to flourish.

events.title: 9 killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting
events.description: Authorities report that nine people have died and at least 10 others are injured after a shooting at a South African pub. The incident occurred early Sunday in Bekkersdal, west of Johannesburg.

events.title: At least 9 killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting
events.description: Authorities report that nine people have died and at least 10 others are injured after a shooting at a South African pub

events.title: World News in Brief: More UN staff detentions in Yemen, peacekeepers killed in Sudan sent home, attacks in Ukraine
events.description: The UN Secretary-General on Friday condemned the arbitrary detention of 10 more UN personnel by Houthi de facto authorities in Yemen, warning that the growing crackdown is crippling humanitarian operations and putting millions of lives at risk.

events.title: Families mourn loved ones lost in Bondi Beach terror attack: ‘No words can describe the pain’
events.description: Families of Bondi Beach shooting victims share heartbreaking tributes to their loved ones killed in the deadly terror attack during Hanukkah celebration.

events.title: Taiwan attacker planned assault that killed 3 and injured 11, authorities say
events.description: Taiwanese authorities says the suspect who killed three people and injured 11 others in knife and smoke-grenade attacks in the island’s capital had planned the assaults and set fires at other locations earlier in the day

events.title: Albanese orders review of federal intelligence and policing processes in lead-up to Bondi beach attack
events.description: Former Asio chief Dennis Richardson to lead review into AFP and Asio processes amid growing calls for a royal commission Victims of Bondi beach shooting Ten minutes of terror: how the Bondi mass shooting unfolded in real time – video Follow the latest live updates Anthony Albanese has announced a major review into intelligence and law enforcement processes in the lead-up to the Bondi beach attack, which will consider whether agencies have the right powers to keep the community safe. Amid growing pressure for a commonwealth royal commission into the killing of 15 people at a Hanukah event last Sunday, Albanese said the former Australian Security Intelligence Organisation (Asio) boss Dennis Richardson would lead a review of the agencies. Continue reading...

events.title: World News in Brief: UN to evacuate Kadugli base in Sudan, celebrating migrant contributions, ending colonialism
events.description: The United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (UNISFA) will evacuate its logistics base in Kadugli, Sudan, in the wake of the “heinous attack” this past weekend that killed six Bangladeshi peacekeepers and seriously injured eight others.

events.title: Israeli death penalty bill violates international law: Palestinian analysts
events.description: Israel pushes death penalty for Palestinians, prompting accusations of racism and violations of global conventions.

events.title: U.S. launches strikes in Syria targeting Islamic State fighters after American deaths
events.description: The Trump administration launched military strikes in Syria to "eliminate" Islamic State group fighters in retaliation for an attack that killed two U.S. troops and an American interpreter a week ago.

events.title: At least 8 dead and dozens wounded in Russian strike on Ukraine's Odesa port
events.description: A Russian missile strike on port infrastructure in Odesa has killed eight people and wounded 27, according to Ukraine’s emergency service

events.title: Claudio Manuel Neves-Valente identified as Brown University and MIT shooting suspect, found dead
events.description: Authorities identified the Brown University shooting suspect as Claudio Manuel Neves-Valente. Two students were killed and nine were injured in the campus attack.

events.title: Australia commemorates victims of Bondi Beach shooting attack
events.description: Australia is observing a national Day of Reflection one week after the deadly shooting at a Jewish festival on Bondi Beach, with crowds gathering at a waterfront memorial and people across the country lighting candles and holding a minute of silence. France24 correspondent Grégory Plesse reports the latest from Sydney, Australia.

events.title: Sudan war: World urged not to ignore ‘gruesome sexual violence’
events.description: Harrowing new details emerged on Thursday in a UN report detailing targeted sexual violence and summary executions in Sudan’s North Darfur region, attributed to paramilitary fighters who overran the city of El Fasher in late October.

events.title: Sudan: Humanitarian situation is 'worst crisis' of 2025
events.description: Despite ongoing fighting and horrific human rights violations, global attention on the world's worst humanitarian and displacement crises remains low. The situation in Kordofan is worsening.

events.title: US seizes another tanker off Venezuela - as Brazil issues warning
events.description: The US has been warned against risking a "humanitarian catastrophe" in Venezuela after it seized another tanker.

events.title: Israel hits Hezbollah targets in Lebanon ahead of deadline to disarm terror group
events.description: Hezbollah faces new Israeli strikes in southern Lebanon as ceasefire committee prepares to enforce the U.S.-brokered agreement terms by Dec. 31 deadline.

events.title: South Africa shooting live: At least nine people killed near Johannesburg
events.description: At least nine people have been killed and 10 wounded in a mass shooting in the Bekkersdal township.

events.title: South Africa shooting: 'Unknown gunmen' kill 9 people
events.description: Gunmen are said to have opened fire in a township near Johannesburg. At least 9 are dead and several others injured, local media have reported.

events.title: UN urges calm in Bangladesh after killing of protest leader sparks unrest
events.description: The United Nations has urged calm in Bangladesh after the killing of a prominent youth protest leader sparked fresh unrest, raising concerns about political violence and the safety of civic space as the country prepares for elections early next year.

events.title: Civilians at risk amid escalating Thailand-Cambodia conflict: UN rights chief
events.description: Intensifying air strikes and heavy artillery fire across Thailand and Cambodia have left civilians increasingly at risk, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk warned on Thursday.

events.title: Australia anti-terror police detain 7 men as country lays youngest Bondi Beach victim to rest
events.description: Australian police have detained seven men during anti-terror raids in Sydney on Thursday as the country lays to rest the youngest victim of the deadly Bondi Beach attack.

events.title: Manhunt under way after gunmen kill nine near South Africa’s Johannesburg
events.description: South African police say a manhunt is under way after a mass shooting killed at least nine people and injured 10.

events.title: US plan for $1.6m hepatitis B vaccine study in Africa called ‘highly unethical’
events.description: Experts decry ‘neocolonialist’ Guinea-Bissau study after Trump administration changed advice for US babies The Trump administration has indicated that it will fund a $1.6m study on hepatitis B vaccination of newborns in the west African country of Guinea-Bissau, where nearly one in five adults live with the virus – a move that researchers call “highly unethical” and “extremely risky”. The news follows an official change in recommendations on hepatitis B vaccines at birth from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), which called the shots an “individual” decision, despite decades of safe and effective vaccination and no evidence of harm. It is part of sweeping changes to childhood immunizations by the US health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr, which have global repercussions – including cutting funding for programs that bring vaccines to countries around the world. Continue reading...

events.title: Colombian mercenaries in Sudan ‘recruited by UK-registered firms’
events.description: Exclusive Guardian investigation finds companies set up by people sanctioned by US hired Colombian fighters for Rapid Support Forces, widely suspected of war crimes in Sudan Close to Tottenham Hotspur’s shiny football stadium in London is a squat, nondescript block of flats. It holds a grim secret beyond the unremarkable beige brickwork – a cramped, second-floor apartment in the British capital, linked to murderous atrocities unfolding 3,000 miles south. The one-bedroom flat off north London’s Creighton Road is, according to UK government records, tied to a transnational network of companies involved in the mass recruitment of mercenaries to fight in Sudan alongside paramilitaries accused of myriad war crimes and genocide. Continue reading...

events.title: Seven Colombian soldiers killed in rebel drone attack on base near Venezuela
events.description: Colombia’s ELN guerrilla group used drones and explosives in Thursday night attack that also injured at least 30 soldiers Colombia’s ELN guerrilla group has attacked a military base near Venezuela with drones and explosives, killing seven soldiers and wounding 30. Founded in 1964 and inspired by the Cuban revolution, the ELN is the oldest surviving guerrilla group in the Americas, and controls key drug-producing regions of Colombia. Efforts to negotiate a peace settlement have repeatedly stalled. Continue reading...

events.title: Syria: US launches airstrikes on IS targets after attack
events.description: US officials said the strikes were aimed at IS targets, not the Syrian state, in retaliation for an attack which killed two American servicemen and an interpreter last week.

events.title: Nine people dead after South Africa tavern attack
events.description: Nine people have died and at least 10 others are wounded after a shooting at a South African pub.

events.title: Brown University, MIT shootings: Are elite US universities prepared for targeted violence?
events.description: Campus shootings at Brown University and MIT linked to single suspect with ties to both elite schools. Two killed at Brown, MIT professor murdered.

events.title: Former Hamas hostage warned Australian leaders about dangers of antisemitism months before Bondi Beach attack
events.description: Former Hamas hostage Eli Sharabi had warned Australian leaders about rising antisemitism months before the deadly Bondi Beach Hanukkah shooting attack.

events.title: Aid agencies warn Gaza response at breaking point as Israel urged to lift new restrictions
events.description: Humanitarian agencies working in the Occupied Palestinian Territory (OPT) have warned that life-saving aid operations risk collapse unless Israel immediately lifts new barriers that are blocking access and forcing international charities to shut down.

events.title: Thousands gather as Bondi Beach reopens, commemorating victims of Hanukkah attack
events.description: Police reopened parts of Bondi Beach with thousands forming solidarity circle after mass shooting targeting Jewish community left 15 dead.

events.title: Gunmen kill nine in South Africa tavern attack
events.description: A further 10 people were injured in Bekkersdal after the perpetrators opened fire and "continued to shoot randomly".

events.title: US intercepts second merchant vessel off coast of Venezuela in international waters
events.description: Vessel does not appear to be on list of US-sanctioned vessels, which would represent escalation in blockade US forces on Saturday apprehended a second merchant vessel carrying oil off the coast of Venezuela in international waters in the midst of an American blockade against the country’s oil, according to the US homeland security department. The stoppage follows the seizure by US forces of another oil tanker off Venezuela’s coast on 10 December. Both vessels were headed to Asia. Continue reading...

events.title: Syria’s humanitarian needs remain high despite reduced violence, UN warns
events.description: Humanitarian needs in Syria remain immense despite a year of reduced violence and political change, with millions still displaced, basic services strained and funding shortfalls threatening aid operations, senior UN officials said on Thursday.

events.title: On Maduro’s ‘terror island,’ Hezbollah operatives move in as tourists drift out
events.description: Israel's strikes on Hezbollah are driving the terror group to expand operations in Venezuela, creating new security threats closer to U.S. borders.

events.title: Knife attacker kills three after smoke bombing Taiwan metro
events.description: The suspect's spree began at Taipei's main metro before he moved to another station nearby.

events.title: US announces more than $10bn of arms sales to Taiwan
events.description: Package includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, and has drawn an angry response from China The maps that show how China’s military is squeezing Taiwan The Trump administration has announced a massive package of arms sales to Taiwan valued at more than $10bn that includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, drawing an angry response from China. The state department announced the sales late on Wednesday during a nationally televised address by president Donald Trump, who made scant mention of foreign policy issues and did not speak about China or Taiwan at all. US-Chinese tensions have ebbed and flowed during Trump’s second term, largely over trade and tariffs but also over China’s increasing aggressiveness toward Taiwan, which Beijing has said must unify with the People’s Republic of China. Continue reading...

events.title: Opinion: Remembering the lives lost to a senseless act of terror
events.description: The attack at Australia's Bondi Beach earlier this week on people who were celebrating the first night of Hanukkah was horrific. Stories have emerged about those who died trying to stop the gunmen.

events.title: Bondi Beach terror attack: Australia holds Day of Reflection
events.description: Australia fell silent on Sunday exactly one week after an antisemitic attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach.

events.title: A radio station in Amsterdam is a lifeline for Sudan. After USAID cuts, it's faltering
events.description: Budget cuts threaten the future of Amsterdam-based Radio Dabanga, which has served as an information lifeline for Sudanese people about their war-torn country.

events.title: Calming the mind and promoting global peace on World Meditation Day
events.description: Meditation, which has its roots in religious, yogic and secular traditions from various civilisations, calls for living in the present moment.

events.title: Iran killing spree continues as regime sets new record for 2025 executions, dissident group says
events.description: Human rights crisis deepens as Iran's execution spree reportedly reaches unprecedented levels with over 2,000 prisoners killed so far this year by the Tehran regime.

events.title: Five key moments in the assault on the rights of women and girls in 2025
events.description: Since Trump’s second term began in January, global healthcare, especially for sexual and reproductive health, has been under constant attack This time last year, women’s rights organisations were bracing themselves for a second Trump term. Few were prepared for the chaos that would be unleashed in January. The volume and speed of executive orders coming out of the White House were seen as a deliberate tactic to overwhelm and create panic. In many ways it worked – there was confusion, anger and exhaustion as organisations scrambled to fill the gap left by the USAID freeze. But that was just the beginning. The US administration has been the key driver, supported by intense advocacy work by ultra-conservative groups using the moment to strengthen global ties with political allies. Continue reading...

events.title: Sri Lanka tea workers struggle in poverty. Flooding cost many their lives
events.description: After Sri Lanka struggled through one of the worst storms in its history, tea plantation workers are taking temporary refuge in government schools and temples as entire villages were buried in mud in the central highlands

events.title: US carries out 'massive' strike against IS in Syria
events.description: The US says it struck dozens of targets across Syria in response to last week's deadly Islamic State attack on US forces there.

events.title: Putin vows no more wars if West treats Russia with respect
events.description: Russia's leader said during a TV marathon that claims that an attack on Europe was planned were "nonsense".

events.title: Steve Rosenberg: Was Putin's response to my question about war in Europe an olive branch?
events.description: Russia's leader told our Russia editor that claims an attack on Europe was planned were "rubbish".

events.title: Trump and top aides refuse to rule out war with Venezuela
events.description: President Nicolás Maduro orders Venezuelan navy to escort oil tankers after seizure by US forces What action is Trump taking against Venezuela’s oil industry? Donald Trump and his top advisers have refused to rule out the potential for open conflict with Venezuela as Nicolás Maduro urged his navy to escort oil tankers defying the largest US fleet deployed in the region in decades. In an interview broadcast on Friday morning, Donald Trump told NBC News that going to war with Maduro’s regime remains on the table. “I don’t rule it out, no,” he said in a phone interview with the network. Continue reading...

events.title: Mercosur summit: Lula, Milei clash over US-Venezuela tensions
events.description: Speaking at a Mercosur summit, Lula warned that a US invasion of Venezuela could spark a humanitarian crisis. The Brazilian leader also called on the EU to show "courage" and conclude a deal with the South American bloc.

events.title: India: 7 elephants killed in passenger train collision
events.description: A herd of about 100 wild elephants were trying to cross a railway line when the train driver spotted them. He deployed the emergency brakes but it was too late.

events.title: High-speed passenger train kills 7 elephants crossing railway tracks in India
events.description: Seven wild Asiatic elephants were killed and a calf was injured when a high-speed passenger train collided with a herd in Assam, India

events.title: Sudan war: Kordofan’s El-Obeid ‘one or two steps’ away from being attacked
events.description: As fighting escalates in Sudan, “people are scared, people are fleeing their homes”, the UN migration agency, IOM, said on Friday, noting that more than 50,000 people have been uprooted since late October in the Kordofans region alone.

events.title: Cruise ship chaos mounts as deaths, crimes on board shatter illusions of safety at sea, experts warn
events.description: Cruise ship crimes expose legal loopholes in maritime law. From Amy Bradley's disappearance to recent deaths, experts reveal why ships become crime hotbeds.

events.title: Luigi Mangione lawyers renew bid to toss death penalty charge, alleging Pam Bondi has a conflict of interest
events.description: Luigi Mangione's defense lawyers claim Pam Bondi has conflict of interest in death penalty case due to her former UnitedHealth Group lobbying ties in 2025.

events.title: Putin says Russia won't launch new attacks on other countries 'if you treat us with respect'
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow won't attack other nations if its treated "with respect" and claimed he is "ready and willing" to end the Ukraine war "peacefully."

events.title: How Israel's grassroots hostage families group became a powerful international force
events.description: With just one hostage left in Gaza, members of the forum reflect on its influence in Israel and abroad.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Australian PM announces intelligence review as country mourns Bondi attack
events.description: Anthony Albanese says the country must be in a position to respond to "the rapidly changing security environment".

events.title: Santas and elves rob Montreal grocery store to ‘give food to the needy’
events.description: Group called Robins des Ruelles later said in statement stunt was intended to highlight cost of living crisis Dressed in red suits and backed by masked elves, a group of Santas marched into a Montreal supermarket, loaded their bags with thousands of dollars worth of groceries and disappeared into the night. The bandit Santas later released a statement saying the food would be distributed to the needy, and saying the Robin Hood-style stunt was intended to highlight the spiralling cost of living crisis that has pushed basic necessities increasingly out of reach for ordinary Canadians. Continue reading...

events.title: "I barely slept last night" Excitement builds in Morocco ahead of Afcon
events.description: It's a big day for African football fans, with the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations set to kick off in Morocco. Hosts the Atlas Lions are the big favorite, but they'll face stiff competition from powerhouses like Senegal. The four-week tournament is seen as a high-profile dress rehearsal for the 2030 World Cup, which Morocco will co-host. Ahead of the opening match, we spoke to Moroccan sports journalist Amine El Amri about teams to watch, social unrest surrounding Morocco's sports investment, and the controvercial decision to move the tournament to a four-year cycle.

events.title: Australia launches intelligence review - as Bondi victims honoured in day of reflection
events.description: Australia's prime minister has announced a review of the country's police and intelligence agencies a week after the deadly Bondi Beach gun attack.

events.title: US prisons battle evolving drone technology used to smuggle contraband to inmates
events.description: U.S. prisons are detecting more drones over their facilities than ever before, but federal regulations make it harder for state prisons to take out the threat.

events.title: LIVE: Israel continues ceasefire violations; 1 Palestinian killed in Gaza
events.description: One Palestinian killed by Israeli army in Gaza while two Palestinians, including a child, are shot dead in West Bank.

events.title: TikTok signs Trump-backed deal to avoid US ban
events.description: Joint venture will take over part of app’s US operations, including data protection, algorithm security and content moderation Business live – latest updates US politics live – latest updates TikTok has reached a deal to form a joint venture that will allow it to continue operating in the US, five years after Donald Trump threatened to ban the social media platform over privacy and national security concerns, a move that further strained relations with China. ByteDance, TikTok’s Chinese owner, has signed a deal with Larry Ellison’s Oracle, the private-equity group Silver Lake and Abu Dhabi’s MGX that will allow it to retain control of its core US operations. Continue reading...

events.title: Germany: 1,600 asylum requests by people rejected at border
events.description: The German government said hundreds of people turned away at the border later applied for asylum. Meanwhile, Berlin's mayor is warning New Year's Eve's trouble makers. DW has the latest.

events.title: Famine over in Gaza, situation still 'critical' — monitor
events.description: UN-backed hunger monitor IPC said Gaza was still facing "emergency" levels of hunger and called for increased aid deliveries despite improvements since an October 10 ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.

events.title: Thai deadly border clashes displace over half a million in Cambodia
events.description: Over 500,000 Cambodians have been displaced after two weeks of deadly border clashes with Thailand. The conflict involving drones and air strikes shattered a fragile truce and reignited a decades-old territorial dispute.

events.title: Australia observes moment of silence for Bondi Beach shooting victims
events.description: Australians held a moment of silence on Sunday in tribute to the 15 Bondi Beach shooting victims, marking one week since gunmen fired into Jewish crowds on one of the nation's darkest days. A father and son are accused of targeting the family-thronged Hanukkah festival at Bondi Beach, a tourist hotspot emblematic of Australia's ocean-loving lifestyle.

events.title: At UN, nations pledge people-first digital future, tighter AI safeguards
events.description: UN Member States on Wednesday pledged to narrow widening digital divides and put stronger safeguards around artificial intelligence (AI), as the General Assembly concluded a major review of how the world manages the Internet and fast-evolving digital technologies.

events.title: Several elephants killed in train crash after impact causes multiple coaches to derail
events.description: A high-speed passenger train struck an elephant herd in northeastern India, killing seven wild animals while all 650 passengers escape unharmed.

events.title: The Me Too movement in the age of Trump and Epstein
events.description: Tarana Burke tells Marc Lamont Hill on Epstein, Trump and how widespread sexual violence is in the United States.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Australian state plans tougher laws against displaying extremist flags after Bondi shooting
events.description: The Australian state of New South Wales is proposing a ban on public displays of Islamic State group flags and extremist symbols

events.title: Fifty days on, Jamaica struggles to rebuild after Hurricane Melissa’s unprecedented destruction
events.description: Fifty days have passed since Hurricane Melissa ravaged Jamaica, leaving behind an unprecedented trail of destruction.

events.title: World News in Brief: Progress on hunger in Asia-Pacific, key Gaza pipeline repaired, flu hits Europe hard
events.description: While the Asia and Pacific region has made notable progress in reducing hunger, persistent challenges remain in addressing malnutrition, food insecurity and unequal access to healthy diets, a new UN report published on Wednesday concludes.

events.title: Canadian police expose alleged ISIS conspirator in plot against Jews, women's attempted kidnappings
events.description: Canadian police say Waleed Khan faces terrorism charges for allegedly conspiring with ISIS and committing hate crimes targeting Jewish community in Toronto.

events.title: Kebabs, biryani and much more: Indian city on Unesco culinary list
events.description: Lucknow recently joined a select list of global cities recognised for their fine food.

events.title: Morocco accused of ‘horrific’ abuse of detained gen Z protesters
events.description: As country prepares to host Africa Cup of Nations, families and rights groups tell of police brutality, with hundreds still held The arbitrary detention of hundreds of gen Z protesters in Morocco and alleged “horrific” beatings have been condemned by human rights groups, as the country prepares to host the Africa Cup of Nations on Sunday. A wave of youth-led demonstrations swept across Morocco in late September and early October – the biggest since the 2011 Arab spring – in protest at underfunded healthcare and education. Continue reading...

events.title: Ongoing Ukraine peace talks in Miami 'constructive', Kremlin envoy says
events.description: A Kremlin envoy reported that peace talks in Florida on a US-proposed plan to end the nearly four-year war in Ukraine are progressing "constructively" as part of the Trump administration’s ongoing diplomatic efforts. The talks, involving both Ukrainian and European officials, come amid sharply divergent demands from Moscow and Kyiv.

events.title: Australian authorities release 7 men detained over possible violent plot in wake of Bondi Beach shooting
events.description: Seven men who were arrested due to concerns that they were planning a "violent act" were released. The arrests came days after the shooting at Bondi Beach.

events.title: Putin claims 'troops are advancing,' will achieve goals as EU approves massive Ukraine loan
events.description: As the war between Russia and Ukraine persists, Russian President Vladimir Putin said his nation's "troops are advancing," The Associated Press reported.

events.title: Sixty years ago, the world tried to stop racial discrimination and failed
events.description: Decades after the passing of the UN convention on the elimination of discrimination, systemic racism is still rampant.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Pope Leo summons cardinals for a key assembly to help him govern Catholic Church
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has summoned the world's cardinals for two days of meetings to help him govern the church, in the clearest sign yet that the new year will signal the unofficial start of his pontificate.

events.title: How Trump has supercharged the new world dis-order
events.description: Welcome to the new world dis-order.

events.title: Egypt's el-Sissi urges UN Security Council reforms for Africa's larger role
events.description: Egypt’s President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi has called for changes in the U.N. Security Council to give Africa a bigger role in global decisions

events.title: Pope Leo summons world's cardinals for a key assembly to help him govern the church
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has summoned the world’s cardinals for meetings to help him govern the church, marking the unofficial start of his pontificate

events.title: Gaza: Access to food improves but living conditions remain dire
events.description: A pregnant woman in Gaza thought she might lose her child because of malnourishment. Ten days ago, she gave birth and is now in recovery thanks to World Food Programme (WFP) facilities that are back up and running again, the agency’s representative for Palestine said on Thursday.

events.title: Kylian Mbappe equals Ronaldo record in Real Madrid win over Sevilla
events.description: Real Madrid star forward scores his 59th goal in a calendar year to equal Cristiano Ronaldo's record tally at the club.

events.title: Australia honours Bondi Beach victims, launches probe of security services
events.description: PM Albanese announces review of Australia's law enforcement and intelligence agencies after deadly Bondi Beach attack.

events.title: US, Russian officials meet in Miami for talks on Ukraine war
events.description: Russian envoy Kirill Dmitriev says the talks were 'constructive' and will continue on Sunday.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,396
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,396 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: South Africa in talks with Russia over men ‘tricked’ into fighting in Ukraine
events.description: Government says it received distress calls, as daughter of ex-president Jacob Zuma accused of luring men to frontline South Africa’s government is in talks with Russia to bring home 17 South African men fighting for Russia in Ukraine, after the men were allegedly tricked on to the frontlines of the war by a daughter of former South African president Jacob Zuma. Duduzile Zuma-Sambudla has been accused in multiple lawsuits of luring the 17 South African and two Botswanan men to Russia in July, by telling them they would be training as bodyguards for her father’s uMkhonto weSizwe political party or attending a personal development course. Continue reading...

events.title: UK Foreign Office victim of cyber-attack in October, says Chris Bryant
events.description: Minister says risk to ‘any individual’ from cyber-attack is low and that it is still unclear who is responsible The UK’s Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office was hacked in October, a minister has said. Chris Bryant, a trade minister in Keir Starmer’s government, told Sky News there was a low risk to “any individual” from the cyber-attack. Continue reading...

events.title: Russia says talks on US peace plan for Ukraine 'are proceeding constructively'
events.description: A Kremlin envoy says peace talks in Florida on a U.S.-proposed plan to end the war in Ukraine are proceeding constructively, after U.S. meetings with Ukrainian and European officials in Berlin.

events.title: He's the first African musician to get a Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award
events.description: The late, great Fela Kuti is known as the "Black President" for his role as both a musical and a political leader. Now he has become the first African artist to get this Grammy honor.

events.title: Christmas brings rise in domestic violence in Germany
events.description: For many women, the holiday season is the most dangerous time of the year. Stress, financial worries, and cramped living conditions increase the risk of domestic violence. Women's shelters are overstretched.

events.title: Live: The French presidency ‘welcomes’ Putin's willingness for talks
events.description: The French presidency said Sunday that it welcomed Russian President Vladimir Putin’s willingness to speak with President Emmanuel Macron over the war in Ukraine, adding that the conditions for such talks would be determined in coming days. In an interview published earlier Sunday, a Kremin spokesman said Putin has “expressed readiness to engage in dialogue with Macron". Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

events.title: At least 16 Epstein files have disappeared from the DOJ webpage
events.description: At least 16 Jeffrey Epstein–related files abruptly disappeared from the Justice Department’s public website within a day of their release. The unexplained missing files, including an image with a photo of President Donald Trump, fuelled speculation online about what was taken down and why the public was not notified.

events.title: MAGA civil war steals the spotlight at 'AmericaFest' conference
events.description: AmericaFest, the first major Turning Point USA conference since the murder of its founder Charlie Kirk, took place in Phoenix on Thursday – but instead of showing unity, it exposed sharp rifts within the MAGA movement over anti-Semitism, leadership, and its post-Trump future.

events.title: 'Our daughter vanished 20 years ago - but AI and an ear caught on camera may finally solve the case'
events.description: The parents of a woman who went missing nearly 20 years ago are hoping an AI enhanced picture of a suspect's ear could crack the case.

events.title: Deadline-day release of Epstein files has White House media management written all over it
events.description: Can it be a coincidence that US planes attacked Syria around the very time the Epstein files were released?

events.title: Australia marks Day of Reflection for Bondi Beach shooting victims
events.description: Australians are lighting candles Sunday to remember the victims of a mass shooting at a Jewish festival in Sydney's Bondi Beach

events.title: Russia says talks on US peace plan for Ukraine 'are proceeding constructively'
events.description: A Kremlin envoy says peace talks on a U.S.-proposed plan to end the nearly four-year war in Ukraine are proceeding constructively in Florida

events.title: Crimean Tatar artist moulds new path through clay in wartime Ukraine
events.description: Through her ceramics, Crimean Tatar artist Elvira Demerdzhi finds moments of calm and a sense of home amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.

events.title: LA deputies caught on camera racing into foggy ocean to rescue disoriented paragliders
events.description: Two deputies swam 75 feet to save panicked paragliders entangled in safety equipment, cutting them free with knives in a dramatic ocean rescue operation.

events.title: Desperate search for 2 men underway after fishing boat found empty 70 miles off Florida coast
events.description: The U.S. Coast Guard is searching for a missing uncle and nephew after their fishing boat was found empty 70 miles off the coast of Florida.

events.title: Brown University, MIT shooting suspect likely died days before body found: autopsy
events.description: The suspect in the deadly Brown University shooting and MIT professor killing was found dead by suicide inside a New Hampshire storage unit, ending a nearly weeklong manhunt.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Brown and MIT shooting suspect, Nick Reiner's lawyer, Brian Walshe's sentence
events.description: Stay up to date with the Fox News True Crime Newsletter, which brings you the latest cases ripped from the headlines, from crime to courts, legal and scandal.

events.title: Suspect in Brown shooting, MIT murder found dead and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: US envoy Witkoff says high-level Miami talks focused on 'unified Gazan authority' as Israel ceasefire advances
events.description: The U.S. leads talks with Egypt, Qatar and Turkey on Gaza ceasefire Phase 2, focusing on unified governance and regional integration for long-term stability.

events.title: Zelenskyy calls for US to respond to 'signals' Russia is 'preparing to make next year a year of war'
events.description: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy is calling on America and other allies to respond to "signals" that Russia is "preparing to make next year a year of war."

events.title: US seizes oil tanker off Venezuela in the second interception in two weeks
events.description: The U.S. Coast Guard has intercepted and boarded a second tanker transporting Venezuelan oil, following Donald Trump’s announcement on Tuesday that he was ordering a “blockade” of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela. However, several reports indicate that the vessel was not on the U.S. sanctions list, raising concerns that this move signals a tightening or escalation of enforcement. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem shared a seven-minute video of the operation, showing U.S. helicopters landing on the deck of the Panamanian-flagged ship, which—like a tanker seized earlier this month—was reportedly bound for Asia. Simon Moritz reports.

events.title: Neither Russia nor France: One West African country walks a diplomatic tightrope
events.description: As some West African nations choose to cement old ties with France or a new ally in Russia, Togo wants both.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Umbrellas or barbecues: Christmas weather forecast gifts mixed bag for Australians
events.description: Perth and Brisbane to swelter through hottest conditions of Australia’s capital cities on Thursday Follow the latest live news updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Wildly different weather is on the way across Australia for Christmas Day, as a clearer picture emerges of the forecast for celebrations on Thursday. The Bureau of Meteorology has tipped Perth, at 41C, and Brisbane, 35C, to swelter through the hottest conditions of Australia’s capital cities. Continue reading...

events.title: Germany trains immigrant teachers to fill gaps in schools
events.description: Germany is desperately looking for teachers. And many migrants and refugees were once teachers in their home country. A program in Cologne — and four other cities — is hoping to create a win-win situation.

events.title: How Georgian creatives are fighting for their freedom
events.description: Artists in Georgia are weary but defiant as they face arbitrary arrests, tough new laws and financial hardship from the country's repressive government.

events.title: Christmas villain The Grinch caught stealing presents in Texas
events.description: With Christmas just around the corner and its many traditions returning, the Grinch — the nasty, green, hairy, cynical yet hilarious character — is once again making an appearance, as in the United States, where for several years some people have taken to wearing green costumes to play dirty tricks in the streets, sometimes more or less in collusion with the police, as Morgan Ayre reports.

events.title: 'We will finish Hamas if they don't give us Rani,' says mother of last hostage in Gaza
events.description: Now the other hostages are home, the living and the dead, there is just one face whose image you will see across Israel, alongside the national flag and the ubiquitous yellow ribbon, symbol of solidarity with the hostages.

events.title: US tech enabled China's surveillance empire. Tibetan refugees in Nepal pay the price
events.description: Nepal is just one of at least 150 countries to which Chinese companies are supplying surveillance technology, from cameras in Vietnam to censorship firewalls in Pakistan to citywide monitoring systems in Kenya

events.title: Security Council hears of fading election prospects in Libya
events.description: The path to long-awaited elections in Libya is paved with complications but they can be overcome, the UN Special Representative for the country said on Friday in a briefing to the Security Council.

events.title: Security Council renews DR Congo peacekeeping mission amid renewed M23 offensives in the east
events.description: The UN Security Council on Friday unanimously extended the mandate of the UN peacekeeping mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) for another year, as fighting in the country’s east intensified amid renewed offensives by the M23 rebel group.

events.title: Elizabeth Smart blasts Ghislaine Maxwell’s ‘country club’ prison treatment: ‘Makes me sick’
events.description: Kidnapping survivor Elizabeth Smart speaks out against Jeffrey Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell's prison privileges while advocating for trafficking victims.

events.title: Chinese researcher on US visa charged with smuggling E. coli into the country, FBI Director Kash Patel says
events.description: FBI charges Youhuang Xiang, a post-doctoral researcher and J-1 visa holder from China, with smuggling Escherichia coli (E. coli) into the U.S.

events.title: Milwaukee County judge found guilty of obstructing federal immigration agents in courthouse incident
events.description: Milwaukee County Judge Hannah Dugan found guilty of federal obstruction for helping man evade ICE agents at courthouse, faces up to five years in prison.

events.title: India express train kills seven elephants crossing tracks
events.description: The collision happened early on Saturday in the north-eastern state of Assam, local officials say.

events.title: Christmas spirit returns to Bethlehem after ceasefire in Gaza
events.description: At midnight on Christmas Eve, the hymn “The Night of Christmas” will ring out in Bethlehem’s Church of the Nativity, built on the site where Christians believe Jesus was born

events.title: South Sudan: UN condemns killing of staff member in Wau, calls for swift investigation
events.description: The United Nations on Friday condemned the killing of a civilian staff member serving with its peacekeeping mission in South Sudan (UNMISS), calling on the authorities to swiftly bring those responsible to justice.

events.title: Gaza famine pushed back, but millions still face hunger and malnutrition, UN says
events.description: Food security in Gaza has improved since the ceasefire declared in October, pushing back famine conditions, but the situation remains critical with more than three-quarters of the population still facing acute hunger and malnutrition, a new UN-backed analysis has found.

events.title: Imran Khan and wife given further jail terms after state gift fraud case
events.description: Pakistan's former PM, who is already serving time in prison, plans to challenge the verdict.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Where ISIS is still active today
events.description: The Islamic State lost its territorial stronghold in the Middle East years ago, but its influence didn't disappear. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Aaron Zelin about how ISIS looks now.

events.title: Pakistan sentences ex-PM Imran Khan, wife Bushra Bibi to 17 years in prison
events.description: Imran Khan and his wife Bushra Bibi were found guilty of corruption in relation to selling state gifts. The ruling is the latest legal setback for the former prime minister, who has been jailed since 2023.

events.title: Former Pakistani PM Imran Khan convicted to 17 years in prison
events.description: A court in Pakistan has convicted and sentenced the imprisoned former Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife, Bushra Bibi, to 17 years in prison after finding them guilty of retaining and selling state gifts, including jewellery given by Saudi Arabia in 2021. Khan’s lawyer says he will appeal the ruling on behalf of Khan and his wife. Khan’s opposition PTI party has condemned the decision. Nicholas Rushworth has more.

events.title: Palestinians tell BBC they were sexually abused in Israeli prisons
events.description: Two men say they experienced the kind of abuse highlighted in recent reports on Israel's treatment of prisoners, which Israel denies.

events.title: ‘Slap in the face’: Epstein victims slam release of heavily-redacted files
events.description: Outcry comes as US media report that at least 16 files have disappeared from the public webpage for the Epstein files.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: ‘Matter of survival’: South Korean president urges public health cover for hair loss
events.description: Medical professionals and some in conservative circles feel argument of Lee Jae Myung may be a bit thin South Korean president Lee Jae Myung has instructed his government to consider extending public health insurance to cover hair-loss treatments, arguing that baldness has become a “matter of survival” rather than a cosmetic concern for young people. The proposal, which has since faced a backlash from medical professionals and conservative figures, was announced during a policy briefing on Tuesday and would expand coverage beyond the limited medical treatments currently available for certain types of hair loss. Continue reading...

events.title: Italy: Thousands of dinosaur footprints discovered near Winter Olympics site
events.description: Thousands of dinosaur footprints, dating back over 200 million years, have been discovered on a mountain wall in the Italian Alps, just a short distance from the site of February’s Winter Olympics. Peter O’Brien reports on this Jurassic-era find.

events.title: Africa Cup of Nations begins live on France24, tonight
events.description: It’s a big day for African football fans.The Africa Cup of Nations kicks off this Sunday in Morocco. The opening match this evening in Rabat pits the hosts against Comoros. Morocco’s Atlas Lions are the big favourites, but they’ll face stiff competition from powerhouses such as Senegal. You can follow our coverage tonight on France 24, with our sports reporter Selina Sykes bringing you updates throughout the tournament.

events.title: US forces intercept second merchant vessel off Venezuela amid blockade of sanctioned vessels
events.description: US forces on Saturday stopped an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela for the second time in less than two weeks, following President Donald Trump’s announcement of a blockade on sanctioned vessels. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said the operation, carried out with the Defense Department, targeted a tanker last docked in Venezuela.

events.title: Trump administration restricts Mexican train crews over English proficiency-related safety concerns
events.description: The Trump administration is restricting Mexican train crews in U.S. over English proficiency concerns, limiting operations to 10 miles from border entry points.

events.title: Sports reporter’s 3-year-old opened door for grandpa who then found couple dead in home: report
events.description: The 3-year-old son of Alabama sports reporter Christina Chambers reportedly opened the door for his grandfather, who then discovered Chambers and her husband dead in a suspected murder-suicide.

events.title: This billionaire tested China's limits. It cost him his freedom
events.description: Lai, who is facing life in prison, always said he owed Hong Kong, a city that had given him "everything".

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: ‘I can’t think of a place more pristine’: 133,000 hectares of Chilean Patagonia preserved after local fundraising
events.description: Exclusive: Ancient forests and turquoise rivers of the Cochamó Valley protected from logging, damming and development A wild valley in Chilean Patagonia has been preserved for future generations and protected from logging, damming and unbridled development after a remarkable fundraising effort by local groups, the Guardian can reveal. The 133,000 hectares (328,000 acres) of pristine wilderness in the Cochamó Valley was bought for $63m (£47m) after a grassroots campaign led by the NGO Puelo Patagonia , and the title to the wildlands was officially handed over to the Chilean nonprofit Fundación Conserva Puchegüín on 9 December. Continue reading...

events.title: US seizes second oil tanker off Venezuela's coast
events.description: The move comes after US President Donald Trump ordered a "blockade" of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

events.title: Survivors 'nervous and sceptical' about release of remaining Epstein files
events.description: US lawmakers who pushed for the documents to be made public have criticised the initial release as incomplete.

events.title: Engineer becomes first wheelchair user to go to space
events.description: "It was the coolest experience!" said Michaela Benthaus after the 10-minute Blue Origin flight.

events.title: Who and what are in the Epstein files?
events.description: High-profile figures, including Bill Clinton and Michael Jackson, can be seen in the long-awaited files.

events.title: Make Korea great again: The right-wing group wooing disenchanted youth
events.description: Disgraced president Yoon Suk Yeol has become an unlikely poster boy for anti-government sentiment.

events.title: 'Very cool': The 70s Afro-rock genre enjoying a surprising rebirth
events.description: In 1970s Zambia, Zamrock led a musical revolution. It's now back, with some big names among its proponents.

events.title: Watch: Images, cassettes and high-profile figures from Epstein files
events.description: The partial release of documents includes photos of the late sex offender's properties, audio files and redacted documents.

events.title: Israel’s yellow line in Gaza has become a “site of killing”
events.description: “People don’t know exactly where [Gaza’s yellow line] exists … when they pass it, they become targets.”

events.title: Australia beat England to win third Test and retain Ashes
events.description: Australia win Adelaide Test against England and forge an unassailable 3-0 lead in cricket's longest running series.

events.title: Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua: Is this good for Boxing?
events.description: Samantha Johnson looks at how audience, attention and money are reshaping modern boxing.

events.title: US seizes second oil tanker off Venezuela
events.description: Video shows the moment the US military seizes a second oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela.

events.title: Trump’s approach to Venezuela “ad hoc, unpredictable”
events.description: Former Pentagon official Adam Clements, talks about the latest seizure by the US of a Venezuelan oil tanker.

events.title: Vigil in London for Palestinian prisoners held in Israel
events.description: Dozens of people gathered in central London on Saturday calling for the release of Palestinian prisoners held in Israel.

events.title: Al Jazeera launches new integrative AI model, ‘The Core’
events.description: Al Jazeera Media Network says initiative will shift role of AI 'from passive tool to active partner in journalism'.

events.title: Israeli truce violations making Gaza peace efforts ‘incredibly difficult’
events.description: Turkish FM criticises Israeli actions in Gaza as he meets senior officials from the US, Egypt and Qatar in Miami.

events.title: US seizes second oil tanker off Venezuela’s coast
events.description: Caracas slams the US over 'the theft and hijacking' of a second oil tanker and says it will file a complaint at the UN.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: U.S. forces stop a 2nd merchant vessel off Venezuela coast, officials say
events.description: U.S. forces stopped a vessel off the coast of Venezuela for the second time in less than two weeks as President Trump continues to ramp up pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: In the shadow of U.S. export controls, China rallies its own chip industry
events.description: The chip industry in China is hustling to overcome a Western tech choke hold, even as President Trump appears poised to loosen U.S. chip restrictions.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Russia say peace deal hampered by changes
events.description: Moscow denied plans for three-way talks between Ukraine, Russia and the US, while diplomats from all three countries were in Miami. The Kremlin has slammed Ukrainian, European changes to the peace deal. Follow DW.

events.title: Christmas in the air: Why scents spark emotions and memories
events.description: The scent of fresh pine and apple cider makes you think of the holidays at grandma's house? You're not alone. Smells are our strongest sensory trigger for memories — both happy and painful.

events.title: US: Tens of thousands left without power in San Francisco
events.description: The tech hub saw a power outage affecting some 130,000 people, as well as traffic and public transport. Authorities have urged people to stay at home.

events.title: US seizes another oil tanker off Venezuela
events.description: The seizure comes as US President Trump has ordered a blockade to prevent sanctioned oil tankers from entering and exiting Venezuela. Caracas said the US engaged in "theft and hijacking" of a private vessel.

events.title: German engineer becomes first wheelchair user to visit space
events.description: German engineer Michaela Benthaus, who has paraplegia, traveled to space with Jeff Bezos' company Blue Origin.

events.title: Perfume's multicultural journey: From antiquity to TikTok
events.description: Though often marketed through a Eurocentric lens, perfume's multilayered history spans Mesopotamia, India, Egypt and Europe, besides being retold on PerfumeTok.

events.title: Labor rights in Europe: Who's working over Christmas?
events.description: From the number of paid days off to the size of the Christmas bonus, not all European countries are equal for workers over the holidays.

events.title: US Justice Department begins release of some Epstein files
events.description: The Justice Department has dropped some of the files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Former president Bill Clinton features heavily, but the documents make scant reference to Donald Trump.

events.title: Mercosur Summit kicks off: Lula calls on EU to sign the deal
events.description: The summit at which South American leaders had hoped the Mercosur trade agreement would finally be signed ultimately took place without their European counterparts. EU leaders are postponing the conclusion amid large-scale demonstrations by farmers, who say the accord would disadvantage them. Gaelle Fonseca and Simon Moritz take a look.

events.title: Epstein files: At least 16 documents have disappeared
events.description: At least 16 files disappeared from the US Department of Justice’s public webpage containing documents related to Jeffrey Epstein less than a day after they were posted, including a file featuring a photograph connected to former President Donald Trump. The removals occurred without any explanation from the government or notice to the public. Trump has consistently denied any knowledge of Epstein’s crimes and has said he distanced himself from his former friend years ago. Being named or included in the files does not imply wrongdoing. The unexplained removals have sparked anger among politicians, as well as victims of the late sex offender and their families. Morgan Ayre has the details.

events.title: Breaking barriers: Teen racer Skye Parker takes on Formula 4
events.description: Why should Formula 1 be a male preserve? While no regulations bar women from competing, they remain notably absent from the grid. This question is at the heart of the stories of Skye Parker, a young Welsh woman, alongside Eliza Herbert and Elise Gallé-Tessonneau.

events.title: Key takeaways from the Justice Department release of thousands of Epstein files
events.description: The US Justice Department on Friday released a tranche of files related to convicted sex-offender Jeffrey Epstein in accordance with a congressional mandate. The partial disclosure has already drawn criticism from lawmakers and victims’ advocates, who cite the wholesale redaction of some pages and say key documents were withheld.

events.title: 'A slap in our faces': Epstein victims express shock and outrage over incomplete release of files
events.description: Several victims of Jeffrey Epstein have told Sky News that the incomplete release of the files relating to the dead paedophile financier have left them feeling shocked, outraged and disappointed.

events.title: England beaten by Australia in historic Ashes defeat
events.description: England have lost the third Test in an historic Ashes defeat against Australia, who claim victory after just 11 days of cricket.

events.title: Engineer becomes first wheelchair user to fly to space
events.description: An engineer has become the first wheelchair user to go to the edge of space.

events.title: A Brazilian judge allows ex-President Bolsonaro to leave prison for a hernia surgery
events.description: Brazil’s former President Jair Bolsonaro, who has been serving a 27-year prison sentence for an attempted coup since November, will be allowed to leave prison for a hernia surgery

events.title: Pakistani court sentences former PM Imran Khan and wife to 17 years in graft case
events.description: A Pakistani court has convicted former Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife, Bushra Bibi, sentencing them to 17 years in prison

events.title: Funeral for slain Bangladeshi activist draws hundreds of thousands
events.description: Hundreds of thousands of people have attended the funeral of a leading Bangladeshi activist, Sharif Osman Hadi, who died from gunshot wounds

events.title: UN urges Rwanda to leave eastern Congo, extends peacekeeping mission for a year
events.description: The U.N. Security Council has urged Rwanda to withdraw its forces from eastern Congo and extended the U.N. peacekeeping mission in Congo for a year

events.title: Saudi Arabia quietly expands access to its only alcohol store for non-Muslim residents
events.description: Saudi Arabia has quietly expanded access to its only alcohol store, now allowing non-Muslim Premium Residency holders to purchase alcohol legally

events.title: Artist's battlefield collection captures the lived experience of Ukraine's resistance to invasion
events.description: Ukrainian street artist Maxim Kilderov is building a powerful collection of battlefield artifacts documenting Russia’s invasion of Ukraine

events.title: Iraq's political future in limbo as factions vie for power
events.description: Political factions in Iraq have been maneuvering since the parliamentary election more than a month ago to form alliances that will shape the next government

events.title: Prisoners freed by Belarus say their passports are taken away in a final 'dirty trick' by officials
events.description: Even though Belarus has released dozens of prisoners, those who've been freed say the authoritarian government often delivers one final act of repression by confiscating their passports before deporting them

events.title: Can traditional medicine strengthen modern healthcare? An expert weighs in
events.description: Ginger and cinnamon are more than just ingredients. Along with other spices, their medicinal value is gaining both attention and legitimacy.

events.title: Sudan: Needs rise as people continue to flee fighting in Kordofan
events.description: Families continue to flee intense hostilities across the Kordofan region of Sudan and humanitarian needs are surging, the UN said in an update on Wednesday.

events.title: Gun jams as shoplifting suspect tries to shoot Ohio police officer at point-blank range in wild bodycam video
events.description: Wild bodycam footage shows a shoplifting suspect allegedly attempting to shoot an Ohio police officer at Walmart, but the gun malfunctioned during the incident.

events.title: DHS packages latest ICE arrests as 'Christmas gift to Americans'
events.description: The Department of Homeland Security calls ICE arrests of illegal immigrants with criminal records the agency's "Christmas gift to Americans."

events.title: University of Illinois lesson materials push leftist race, class struggles on future teachers: leaked lectures
events.description: Leaked PowerPoint slides from University of Illinois teacher education course reveal left-wing ideology woven into curriculum for future educators.

events.title: Florida cold case breakthroughs: Sheriff’s unit cracks two long-unsolved killings
events.description: Authorities in Florida announced breakthroughs in two long-unsolved Kissimmee homicide cases, bringing closure to one family and charges in another.

events.title: Minneapolis police chief blasts ICE after agent seen dragging woman through street, kneeling on her back
events.description: Minneapolis' police chief condemns "disturbing" incident where an ICE agent was caught on video kneeling on pregnant woman's back and dragging her through the street.

events.title: Albanian opposition lawmakers light flares, scuffle with police amid parliament chaos over corruption probe
events.description: Albania's parliament erupted in chaos as opposition lawmakers clashed with police over corruption charges against Deputy Prime Minister Belinda Balluku.

events.title: Vatican confirms resignation of Cardinal Timothy Dolan, announces new archbishop of New York
events.description: Vatican accepts Cardinal Dolan resignation as New York archbishop, naming Ronald Hicks as successor to lead the archdiocese starting February 2026.

events.title: Can Maduro survive as Trump's oil pressure campaign hits his regime’s weak spot?
events.description: U.S. limits on Venezuelan oil exports are cutting the revenue that once sustained Nicolás Maduro, weakening his cash flow and putting the regime’s stability at risk.
